body.p: Born on October 20, 1820 in Nashville, Tennessee. Worked as a Farmer on his family Plantation. Fought in the Mexican American War as Captain in the 1st Tennessee Infantry. Cheatham was promoted to corporal of the 3rd Tennessee Infantry. In 1849, he moved to California to participate in the Gold Rush, but returned home to Tennessee in 1853. Once home, he maintained his involvement in the local militia being awarded the rank of Brigadier General and operated his family plantation and a Planter. In May of 1861, Cheatham was commissioned as Brigadier General in the Confederate Army. Served in the Confederate Army as a part of the Army of Mississippi and the Army of Tennessee, achieving the rank of Major General in May 1862. He was paroled on May 1, 1865. Cheatham Died on September 4, 1886.
